dmca.title: [ABUSE] (no subject)
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Tuesday, February 28, 2006 9:40 AM
To: dorkland1@mchsi.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: Re: [ABUSE] (no subject)]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] (no subject)
Date: Tue, 28 Feb 2006 09:13:12 -0600
From: Davey <dorkland1@mchsi.com>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>
References: <000601c63c30$1b971220$a307d90c@nonee4525af732>
<44044AA9.1030009@theplanet.com>

the i.p. address of this fake clone is 67.19.28.69:28960..he has copied
everything about my server  right down to the server message that all he did
was copy and paste off of my server...using my name and my server name..look
for yourself
- ----- Original Message -----
From: "Policy Enforcement" <abuse@theplanet.com>
To: "Davey" <dorkland1@mchsi.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 28, 2006 7:05 AM
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] (no subject)


> Please send the URLs to the abuse you are citing and further details 
> that illustrate your claim. If you wish to use or attorney, or 
> threaten to use him or her again, then simply have your attorney contact
our attorneys.
>
> Policy Enforcement
> The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
> http://www.theplanet.com/legal/
>
> Davey wrote:
>> hey i run two call of duty united offensive servers under the name of 
>> Dorf's War  and Dorfs War2...so today i find a server being hosted by 
>> you guys that copied my name and all the info on my server...you need 
>> to either shut them down or have them change there name or i will 
>> have to take matters to my attorney.....thanks.....and a reply to 
>> this matter would be nice so i know things are taking care of....
> 


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFEBG7lvK/XpJs6oyURAtaaAKCCyONhYmgu5tcdfyia5P8GU8GxgACcC7Ww
Oy62dVKzqWZyAC1cRtLrbNY=
=C5l7
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
